bio.words: I was born a Kiwi (a New Zealander) in   Masterton, New Zealand on April 14, 1927, and still am a Kiwi by   New Zealand law, although I became a naturalized United States   citizen many years ago in order to have the right to vote in US   elections and, hence, voice my political opinions in a meaningful   way. My father, an engineer, was unemployed for four years during   the Great Depression which hit New Zealand rather severely in the   early 1930s. Since jobs were believed to be more plentiful in the   vicinity of Wellington, the capital city of New Zealand, located   at the bottom of the North Island, we moved to Lower Hutt a few   miles from Wellington. There my two older brothers and my elder   sister were able to find jobs while I and my younger sister were   still at primary school.
bio.title: Alan G. MacDiarmid - Biographical

motivation: "for the discovery and development of conductive polymers"
